text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Government sets up a task-force to streamline bureaucracy following presidential order number 10. Junior administration reform minister Ameur Harkat says the task-force will prepare a charter on administration works.
- Seven people killed in the southwestern province of Saida.
- At least 5,500 private enterprises are competing with 7,000 state-owned businesses in the import-export sector since the liberalisation of trade in 1993.
- Ramadan fasting month has made known more poor in Algeria.

- Workers' union leader Abdelhaq Benhamouda will quit his position as a secretary general of the Union Generale des Travailleurs Algeriens (UGTA) this year to found a political party. "My party will be centrist," says Benhamouda. MATIN
- The Transitional National Council debates party and election laws to reinforce multiparty democracy in Algeria.
- Tabainat villagers mourn 14 people killed in the village in Blida province, 50-km (30-miles) south of Algiers.
